ai.summary: The Heversham Trail is a roughly 10.2 km moderate hike in the UK, offering a varied countryside experience. The route typically combines rural tracks, fields and occasional woodland, suitable for hikers with some experience and good footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of well-defined rural paths, grassy trails and short sections of uneven ground. Surface can be grassy, muddy after rain, and there may be gentle rises and descents with occasional stony patches. Navigation relies on waymarked paths or local routes.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Bring a map and compass or GPS, plus a charged phone. Carry water and snacks, a small first aid kit, and a warning whistle. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of livestock and cattle, and tell someone your planned route and return time.
recommended_gear: Waterproof bag or rain cover for gear
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn are ideal; winter hiking is possible with proper gear and careful planning.
